storyInfo: As the group enters the Abyss, Priestess relocates the Doctor, Kal'tsit, and Amiya onto the deck, leaving the rest to fight PRTS's attacks.

attributes.content: The connection between us will transcend even time and space. I am sure of it.

Even if the ocean completely boils away and the atmosphere vanishes, even if all the moons in the sky are pulled into the vortex of our planet's gravity, and even if the sun continues to mercilessly expand, eventually swallowing up all its children until none can be heard...
I am sure we will meet again. At the far end of our civilization, once adorned by darkness and the brilliance of the stars up above, we will meet once again.
I will wait until that day comes. I promise you I will. Wait for me. You must wait for me too.
...Don't ever forget about me.
Is it time...?
I should still be alive. This can't be an illusion.
This is the Rhodes Island I'm familiar with, and it seems to be operating as usual. Therefore, It is definitely not here yet.
Is she still asleep? What of Originium's current state...?
And as for the changes happening to this planet...
You're still here, AMa-10.
Perfect... Let's go for a walk outside.
From a distance away, a black-haired woman dressed in a white coat stands on the deck, concentrating her gaze at the sky.
Until she notices the two of you and turns around, a bright smile on her face.
You are absolutely certain you have seen this face before.
Perhaps in a dream within dreams, or in the depths of your dormant memories.
But this moment is no dream.
You can clearly perceive her presence and existence right before you with each of your senses.
Doctor, this woman... is the Priestess you talked about?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The enemy Dr. Kal'tsit has been guarding against...?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya does not understand the danger she faces, but still she stands in front of you instinctively, ready to engage in combat.
You are unable to determine how exactly the current situation will unfold, but know very well this is not at all like any powerful foe or crisis you have faced before.
The woman seems to show no hostility, but still your instinct tells you—unfathomable danger lies right before your eyes.
Gently, she begins to speak.
You're a step ahead of me, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You didn't wait for me in the awakening room, to share a mutual joy in seeing this new world for the first time.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But how could I possibly blame you for a little impatience?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You also feel her pure, sincere gaze.
From the distance wind blows and thunder rolls, along with the faint rustling of Originium spreading.
Within the clamor and chaos of this space, she fixes her eyes on you as if nothing else exists.
This reunion is not what I expected, but I'm willing to accept an unorthodox experience.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: We've dreamed together too many times to count, how we would meet again when we awoke from our deep sleep.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: We could wander freely on this planet completely covered by Originium, in a world that belonged only to us.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: A world only one step away from our shared, ultimate vision, and we'd walk towards our new hope...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It ought to be a bright, sunny day too.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Doctor, look! The clouds in the sky—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Amiya hurriedly shouts a warning at you when she notices the sky's unnatural appearance.
But you fail to comprehend just what your eyes are currently seeing.
As soon as Priestess finishes speaking, thick Catastrophe clouds begin to contract and fold in a neat yet strange manner until they vanish completely, leaving a canvas-like sky.
Catastrophes, the most horrific disasters to happen to this land—gone, just like that.
You realize a terrible truth.
{@nickname}, your question sounds like you're asking a stranger.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: We created it together. A crystallization that belongs to only the two of us, a seed of hope.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But tragically... you don't remember anymore, do you?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I know you lost part of your memories in a series of unfortunate accidents.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It's a pity, but I believe your partial memory loss will not change your nature, and the connection between us remains unshakable.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I've no wish to be harsh on you, but I hope you can understand—time is short, and we have much to do.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Though, we can still enjoy our time working together, yes?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Return to my side, Dr. {@nickname}...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The gentle call seems to ring suddenly in your ears, and you feel incomparably close to the voice.
You are certain you cannot recall a single shred of her in your mind, yet your connection goes beyond memories, or perhaps information contained in language.
An almost instinctive reaction.
You cannot help but take a step forward.
Dr. {@nickname}!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit is behind you, gripping your arm. You feel feeble tremors through her palm.
You realize now she has been silent the whole time. Since leaving the sarcophagus, she has been so weak, at this point, she even seems to be struggling to stand.
You are baffled.
You expected Kal'tsit to give you some sage advice, like usual, or perhaps a simple and clear solution.
But now she seems to be suffering from terrible torment, her face bearing struggle and pain.
After an endless instant, she loosens her grip.
She leaves the choice for you to make.

attributes.options: I won't let Originium destroy Terra.

attributes.content: You see her eyes darken. A clear sign of disappointment. You don't know why, but your heart suddenly tightens.
So it's you... AMa-10. It's been a long time for us too.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Your current appearance is vastly different from the look you were born with, but I certainly recognize my very own creation that I poured my heart into.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: In the past four million plus natural day cycles, you seem to have exerted a lot of effort, but your behavioral standards appear to clash with the preset goal encoded at your birth.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I'd like to know just what changed your mind.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Unlike your despicable fraud...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...My end goal has never changed.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Indeed... you regarded that one's order as an inviolable mandate.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: So you hindered the Originium plan, and wasted our already limited time.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: So, {@nickname}, how should I make you understand—
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Just how disappointed I am?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: And how should I forgive your betrayal?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: Kal'tsit, what is the meaning of this?

attributes.content: I've noticed, AMa-10.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You've already broken the language ban I put in place, correct?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Such a precaution was not enough to restrict your actions, for you always find a way...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But if that's the case, why not just say it?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Everything you've wanted to say to {@nickname} this whole time, but couldn't?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Priestess...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *Expletive from an unknown language*.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ascalon and the Elite Operators are momentarily stunned after entering the rift.
This is the Abyss?!
attributes.name: Mechanist

attributes.content: Raidian, can you confirm if we're still inside the Rhodes Island landship?
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Unable to detect any electromagnetic signals outside this space. Hm... no way to tell.
attributes.name: Raidian

attributes.content: Everyone falls into brief silence, waiting for a commander's directive as usual.
Where's the Doctor?
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: And where are Dr. Kal'tsit and Amiya?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Once we entered the rift, I lost track of their positions.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Constant white noise fills the vast white space, the sound of operating machinery emanating from the center.
If this place is indeed the Abyss, then clearly it's distorting our perception of physical space.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: Mantra's voice comes to everyone's minds as they learn this at the same time.
There's no way to identify the material the walls are made of.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: He looks back in the rift's direction, but it is no longer there.
Currently there's no way to cut open these strange walls, so there's no way to confirm their whereabouts.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: I trust Amiya and Dr. Kal'tsit will manage to keep the Doctor safe.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: We can only wait and adapt accordingly.
attributes.name: Touch

attributes.content: We haven't received any new commands, so we should continue executing our original task.
attributes.name: Touch

attributes.content: Then let's not delay any longer.
attributes.name: Stormeye

attributes.content: Mechanist, Sharp and I will cover you while you close in on that unknown machine. Verify if its related to PRTS.
attributes.name: Stormeye
Ascalon
attributes.content: We can back you up anytime—

attributes.name: Ascalon
attributes.content: Something's off. There are no high-threat targets here.
attributes.joined: We can back you up anytime—Something's off. There are no high-threat targets here.

attributes.content: That's unusual.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: According to Dr. Kal'tsit and the Doctor's speculations, the Originium entities we've run into all come from the Abyss...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: But there's like no defenses installed here at all—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I hear... pain.
attributes.name: Rosmontis

attributes.content: What's wrong, kitten?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Rosmontis, do you feel any other abnormalities within your body?
attributes.name: Touch

attributes.content: No, it's not my own...
attributes.name: Rosmontis

attributes.content: A huge black vortex spins slowly under the transparent floor. It starts to speed up.
The unidentifiable instrument right above it begins to flash red.
Detecting a large amount of interference signals.
attributes.name: Raidian

attributes.content: That instrument is currently transmitting a huge volume of data—
attributes.name: Raidian

attributes.content: Could the black vortex underneath... be a visualization of all that information?
attributes.name: Raidian

attributes.text: \n\nLoading threat targets data files, generating targeted countermeasure strategies...
This is a final warning from PRTS.

attributes.content: Gah, so we're intruders now?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Doesn't look like you're giving us any option to leave though.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: So, Ascalon?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Sweep up Rhodes Island's trash.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Nice, I like that.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Don't care where all this stuff came from, but we'll let them know just to whom Rhodes Island belongs.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, ever since you woke up in Chernobog, I have refrained from confessing the whole truth about your past.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The ban placed on me is only part of the cause.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: As for the other reasons... I have said before no one else should tell you about your past.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Language has no way of reconstructing objective facts, while emotions will distort its delivery.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So I needed you to see and judge for yourself, to re-evaluate this land on your own.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Only then could you formulate your own answers about how you regard this land, and about yourself.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I still believe it's important to do it this way.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The same way someone once treated me.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: I am Dr. {@nickname}.;I am the Doctor of Rhodes Island.;I am a soul walking this vast land.

attributes.content: This may be the last chance I have to share that information, however.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Perhaps only now do I, too, have the confidence to share it after all that you and Rhodes Island have been through together.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Please trust that I talk only of your past, and it has nothing to do with your future.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit walks up by your side, facing you and Amiya.
She slowly begins to speak.
Dr. {@nickname}, you ought to already know that Originium, a bearer of both life and danger to Terra, is the legacy of a previous age.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It was one of countless methods used by the previous civilization against an ultimate threat.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: After countless efforts and sacrifices, Originium was finally completed by Oracle and Priestess.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'Oracle' was your previous code name.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: ...I was the one who brought suffering upon this land?

attributes.content: Please know that was not your intention.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Originium points to two futures for this land... Oracle hoped to leave Originium as a gift for future civilizations, to guide them forward...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To help them enter the next stage of civilization.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Over the past ten thousand years, Originium has helped civilization on Terra to develop, but also unexpectedly brought suffering to the land via Oripathy.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You were indeed tormented by this before.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I still remember... when the Doctor...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Doctor has never given up the possibility of curing Oripathy.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: However, someone forced a different future upon you. And for this... you made a choice that went against your original intentions.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Someone once told me to trust in your character, to look for your true self, beyond what memory shapes you. It was an incomparably difficult path for me to walk.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But I'm glad... it was the correct choice to make.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, that's all I wanted to tell you. They are only your past, and you will always be able to decide your own future.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: I'll never break my promise.;I'll never abandon my mission.

attributes.content: Then I too... will fulfill my oath.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname}, I will protect you and Amiya until the end.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This is not the best opportunity to do so, but it is my final one.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm sorry, to entrust such a risk to you and Amiya... but this is a choice I must make.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: What sort of risk?;What sort of choice?

attributes.content: You see Kal'tsit's mouth move, her final words.
Are you done? You've said what you wanted to say?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I'm astonished by how much you know about the past, and I don't completely agree with how you've described it... but that's no longer important.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: AMa-10, what can you even achieve as you are now?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: ...Mon3tr!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Excited whinny)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Destroy her.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: She is the Priestess of a previous civilization. Creator of Originium, and attempting to assimilate everything within it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And therefore, the enemy of all life on Terra.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So this is your choice...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I'm Kal'tsit, a doctor of Rhodes Island, and also the companion of Amiya and the Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You have long been worthless to me.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit
